top_categories.workout_context: Lost and Found Gravel's California Sierra Nevada, Mountain gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 65 miles.
92ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Lost and Found Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
At Lost and Found Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Lost and Found Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
6,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
6,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Lost and Found Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
65 miles on California Sierra Nevada gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Low-cadence force work for 6,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on California Sierra Nevada gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Lost and Found Gravel’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Lost and Found Gravel. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Lost and Found Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on california sierra nevada gravel to build confidence. Expect: california sierra nevada, mountain gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 65 miles of california sierra nevada gravel in Portola, California.
